snippet: Some professors worry about opening a college in such a restrictive nation. Administrators say there was plenty of time to object.
abstract: Yale faculty members, unhappy about absence of vote on venture with National University of Singapore, raise concerns about joining their storied institution with an autocratic city-state; many say project is a dangerous collaboration with government that does not support the broad freedoms they believe are central to liberal arts education; Yale administration says faculty has had ample opportunities to weigh in since Sept 2010 prospectus outlining the project.
lead_paragraph: Some professors worry about opening a college in such a restrictive nation. Administrators say there was plenty of time to object.

headline.seo: Singapore Partnership Creates Dissension at Yale
headline.main: Faculty Gives Yale a Dose of Dissent Over Singapore
headline.print_headline: Wary of Singapore as a Partner, Professors Give Yale Its Own Dose of Dissent
